content: Who painted the Sistine Chapel ceiling between 1508 and 1512 under the patronage of Pope Julius II?

The Sistine Chapel ceiling was painted by Michelangelo Buonarroti, an Italian sculptor, painter, architect, and poet of the High Renaissance. He was commissioned by Pope Julius II to repaint the ceiling, which was originally blue with golden stars. The project took place between 1508 and 1512, and the frescoes on the ceiling are some of the most renowned works of art in the world, featuring scenes from the Book of Genesis, including the famous depiction of the Creation of Adam, where God and Adam's fingers almost touch.
